div.font: Welcome to Southeast Fountain School Corporation!Â Southeast Fountain Schools, in partnership with the community, maintains a safe and caring environment and provides students opportunities to develop skills for lifelong learning.

School Closure Update COVID-19Â (4-2-2020)
School Closure Update COVID-10Â (4-2-2020) (Spanish version)â

ul.li: The site below is kept updated with lists of Food Banks and Meal Distribution sites throughout Indiana.

li.span: Elementary School has opened online pre-registration for Kindergarten Round-Up for the 2020-2021 school year.
We have an online form for all parents of
students to fill out.Â This will help us gather new student information and contact information for new parents/guardians.Â Â

ul.li: We ask that the forms please be completed by May 1, 2020 if you are enrolling your new Kindergarten student at SEF Elementary for the 2020-2021 school year.â

li.span: For questions, please send an email to
Click the following link to complete the Kindergarten Pre-Registration form:

em.font: âMessage from SEFSC Superintendent, Dan Foster:

br.br:
Dear Parents/Guardians,
We hope you and your family are well and staying safe from the virus. Please keepÂ promoting social distancing as much as possible.Â On behalf of the Board of School Trustees and the entire staff at Southeast Fountain, IÂ want to thank you so much for your patience during this unprecedented situation.Â Clearly we are in uncharted territory and there is no wrong answer because I'm not sure
there is a right answer for everything transpiring. However,In an attempt to answerÂ some of your questions, we have created a COVID-19/Coronavirus website that can beÂ found:
https://www.sites.google.com/sefschools.org/covid-19/home
I encourage you to scrollÂ the tabs at the top of the page for more specific information. Each school is listed withÂ personnel for school-specific questions (administration, athletics, guidance, technology,Â etc.), however, if you find yourself with a question and you just aren't sure where toÂ send the question, we have created a COVID19info@sefschools.org email address thatÂ will send an email to the administrative team and we will respond accordingly.
We are in the process of providing guidance to instructional staff with ways to check inÂ with their students and offer suggestions for curriculum (as does the âStudent LearningâÂ tab on the website). They will be reaching out to students soon. Included in thatÂ information will be a consent form to allow your student(s) to participate in onlineÂ discussions.
As you are aware, Governor Holcomb has closed all Indiana schools until at least MayÂ 1st. I do not know if this will be extended through the remainder of this school year orÂ not at this time. Please prepare yourselves for the possibility of returning this schoolÂ year as well as the possibility of not returning this school year. We likely will not haveÂ this information for a few more weeks.
In closing, I want to be perfectly clear that there is no requirement for work to be doneÂ and graded nor participation in online discussions; however, since we as the SEFÂ community at large are not ready for eLearning we feel that providing some resourcesÂ and discussions with teachers may prove helpful to those of you at home trying to keepÂ a sense of normalcy for your child(ren). We fully understand and appreciate theÂ challenges this closure has caused many of our families and we pledge to do our bestÂ to help you work through the situation.
âRespectfully,
Dan L. Foster, Ed.S.
Superintendent
